questions.question: Which of the following functions is EVEN?
questions.explanation: Cosine is even because $\cos(-\theta) = \cos \theta$. Its graph is symmetric about the y-axis.

questions.question: If $\sin \theta = 0.5$, what is the value of $\sin(-\theta)$?
questions.explanation: Sine is an odd function, so $\sin(-\theta) = -\sin \theta$.

questions.question: What is the value of $\cos(-60^\circ)$ if $\cos(60^\circ) = 1/2$?
questions.explanation: Since cosine is even, the negative angle produces the same output as the positive angle.

questions.question: Which trigonometric functions are considered ODD?
questions.explanation: Only the cosine-related functions (Cos and Sec) are even; the other four are odd.

questions.question: If $f(\theta) = \sec \theta$, then $f(-\theta)$ equals:
questions.explanation: Secant is the reciprocal of cosine, which is even. Therefore, secant is also even.

questions.question: True or False: The product of two odd trig functions is an even expression.
questions.explanation: True. For example, $\sin(-\theta)\tan(-\theta) = (-\sin \theta)(-\tan \theta) = \sin \theta \tan \theta$, which satisfies the definition of an even expression.

questions.question: What is $\cot(-x)$ in terms of $\cot x$?
questions.explanation: Cotangent is odd because it is the ratio of an even function (cosine) and an odd function (sine).

questions.question: On the unit circle, which coordinate is unchanged when you replace $\theta$ with $-\theta$?
questions.explanation: The x-coordinate represents cosine, which is even and thus stays the same.
